DOC.brief_title: Alpha-Tocopherol , Beta-Carotene Cancer Prevention ( ATBC ) Study
DOC.detailed_description: The ATBC study randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled , primary prevention trial determine whether daily supplementation a-tocopherol , ( SqrRoot ) -carotene , would reduce incidence lung cancer among male smoker . Between 1985 1988 , 29,133 men age 50 69 year , smoke least five cigarette per day , recruit southwestern Finland . Participants randomly assign receive either a-tocopherol dl-a-tocopheryl acetate ( 50 mg/day ) , ( SqrRoot ) -carotene all-trans- ( SqrRoot ) -carotene ( 20 mg/day ) , supplement , placebo capsule 5-8 year ( median 6.1 year ) April 30 , 1993 . Post-intervention follow-up continued Finnish Cancer Registry national registry , epidemiological analysis continue conduct .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA : Current smoker ( five cigarette per day study entry ) Southwestern Finland . EXCLUSION CRITERIA : Females Proven malignancy ( except nonmelanoma skin cancer cancer situ ) Severe angina pectoris Chronic renal insufficiency Cirrhosis liver Chronic alcoholism Anticoagulant therapy Use supplement contain vitamin E great 20 mg/day , vitaming A great 20,000 IU/day , betacarotene great 6 mg/day
